intro: Teucrium polium subsp. expassum, commonly known as the Greek germander, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular blue or purple flowers arranged in spikes, which attract various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its medicinal properties have been historically recognized for their anti-inflammatory and antiseptic qualities.
